p: Patients with cardiac injury had significantly higher in-hospital mortality than those without cardiac injury (log-rank p < 0.001) ( Fig. 1 ). In the multivariable-adjusted Cox proportional hazard regression model, a significantly higher risk of death was shown in patients with cardiac injury than those without (HR, 2.06; 95% CI, 1.31â€“3.24) ( Fig. 2 ).
